contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox UK place |country = England |latitude= 52.4098 |longitude= 0.3022 |official_name= Queen Adelaide |population = |shire_district= [[East Cambridgeshire]] |shire_county = [[Cambridgeshire]] |civil_parish= [[Ely, Cambridgeshire|City of Ely]] |region= East of England |constituency_westminster= |post_town= |postcode_district = CB7 |postcode_area= CB |dial_code= |os_grid_reference= TL 565 814 }} '''[[Adelaide of Saxe-Meiningen|Queen Adelaide]]''', [[Cambridgeshire]], [[England]], is a [[Hamlet (place)|hamlet]] in [[the Fens]] about {{Convert|2|km|mi|abbr=on}} northeast of [[Ely, Cambridgeshire|Ely]]. The [[River Great Ouse]] passes through it. Close to the village is the junction of the [[Fen Line|Fen]], [[Breckland Line|Breckland]] and [[Ely to Peterborough Line|Ely to Peterborough]] railway lines. Consequently, three lines (and one of them twice, as there is a [[Balloon loop|loop]]!) pass through the village and cross the [[B1382 (road)|B1382]], meaning there are three [[level crossing]]s and one railway bridge in quick succession. <gallery> Image:Queen Adelaide, Cambridgeshire village sign (east face).jpg|East face of the village sign Image:Queen Adelaide, Cambridgeshire village sign (west face).jpg|West face of the village sign </gallery> == References == {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category inline|Queen Adelaide, Cambridgeshire}} {{East Cambridgeshire}} [[Category:Villages in Cambridgeshire]] {{Cambridgeshire-geo-stub}}
